title: Head of Tech & Innovation
description:
**Join our innovative team and shape the future of transport and logistics!**

  

  

We're bringing to market a next-generation open platform designed to revolutionize the industry by addressing inefficiencies and promoting sustainable transport solutions.

  

  

At the heart of the Logivity lies a steadfast commitment to sustainability. Our primary goal is to transform our offerings into a net zero portfolio by 2040. To lead by example, we have also decided to focus on our supply chain and transport system by introducing innovative propulsion technology and developing capabilities that optimize the utilization of the transport system.

  

  

Logivity is a digital network powered by blockchain technology that ensures data integrity, secures a single source of truth, and facilitates value exchange within the system. By connecting various stakeholders in the transport industry, such as shippers, carriers, and service providers, Logivity offers a range of services while also providing the opportunity to create and offer your own services on the network. Today we are a team of 20+ people and have plans to grow within the coming years. Logivity is owned by Volvo Group.

**What you will do**
--------------------


As the Head of Technology Innovation of Logivity, you will play a vital role in driving our company's success. You will be responsible for our digital strategy and execution, as well as supporting our commercialization and operations. You will lead, mentor, and inspire multidisciplinary products teams including product owner, designers, architects and developers. In addition, you will also develop architecture and digital capabilities.

  

  

Your expertise will be essential in designing and implementing a digital operating model, including governance processes that fulfill corporate, commercial, and regulatory requirements. We are seeking a hands-on, creative, and collaborative person to help us build our business and achieve our ambitious goals.

  

  

You will report to the CEO and have the financial responsibility as well manage contract, licenses etc. This is an exciting opportunity for a visionary and dynamic Head of Technology & Innovation who is ready to contribute to a growing and innovative company.

**Who are you?**
----------------


As a person you are an inspiration to others and a true team player. You know and appreciate the start-up culture and also see the benefits of being part of the greater Volvo community. Our values connected to Logivity are customer value, owners’ mentality and alignment & collaboration. We believe you have the mindset to “make it happen.”

  

  

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

  

* Have extended experience in related leadership roles
* Are a senior enterprise architect with experience in blockchain and microservice architecture.
* Have experience from companies within the logistic and transportation sector
* Have excellent analytical, strategic conceptual thinking
* Are result and action oriented, with ability to switch from strategic thinking to hands-on IT work
* Have excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to explain digital concepts and technologies to business leaders
**Are we a perfect match?**
---------------------------

If yes, please apply already today but no later than June 15th.

**Curious, and have questions?**
--------------------------------

Please contact: Jessica Öhrblad at jessica.ohrblad@volvo.com

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Enterprise Architect - Autonomous Solutions
description:
*Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.*

**Who are we?**
---------------

**Volvo Autonomous Solutions** (VAS) is the business area within **Volvo Group** that accelerates the development, commercialization and sales of autonomous solutions. The vision for Volvo Group is to be the most desired and successful transport and infrastructure solution provider in the world. We don’t sell trucks and machines: we operate the solutions through the full life cycle to maximize the improvements achievable through autonomy.

  

That goes hand in hand with our long-term ambitions: 100% Safe, 100% Fossil free and 100% more productive. The automation of our vehicles is seen as a natural step towards reaching that goal. Joining the Volvo Group means to contribute to a large global company that is transforming itself towards these ambitions. We are committed to diversity and inclusion, fostering a team culture where differences are seen as a stepping-stone to better results.

  

Want to see our vehicles and machines in action? Check us out **here**

**This is us, your new colleagues?**
------------------------------------


The Enterprise Architecture & Data team in Digital & IT function is a rather new team at Volvo Autonomous Solutions. Our mission is to support V.A.S. to transform from an internal start-up to a scale up, where our contribution is to define and design a new, modern IT landscape. Given the V.A.S. business model we have a greenfield opportunity that we are very excited about. As a team, we approach our IT landscape holistically. We strive to shape a fit-for-purpose IT environment that is cloud first, built on a zero-trust framework, and recognizes data as one of our most valuable assets. We facilitate the work inside V.A.S. by ensuring we have the right tools for the job. To succeed, we fluently blend ambitious strategies with hands-on implementations.

**Who are you?**
----------------


You enjoy the challenge of working in a scale-up and the dynamic environment that comes with that. We believe that you have strong influencing and communication skills. Additionally, you excel in networking and demonstrate a clear understanding of the bigger picture of how digital supports the transportation industry. As V.A.S. is a small business area, with a start-up mentality, it’s important that you are comfortable with a certain level of uncertainty and can navigate in a changing landscape.

  

You understand the complete digital value chain and IT stack from top to bottom and possess the ability to translate it into business benefits and competitive advantage. As you will work with senior business stakeholders and technical architects, we believe you are equally comfortable in communicating effectively with C-suite managers as with developers.

  

From a more technical perspective, you have experience of designing IT landscapes across business functions as well as over technical layers.

  

Given V.A.S. cloud first strategy it’s beneficial if you have experience of:

* Modern cloud architectures
* Modern integrations such as APIs
* Modern SaaS application platforms or complete ERP designs with implementation, preferably using MS Dynamics 365.
**What will you do?**
---------------------


You will, together with the entire team, design and develop a modern and effective IT landscape that enables us to scale as an autonomous Transport-as-a-Service provider. You will manage architecture roadmaps within your area of responsibility and ensure the soundness of that architecture by supporting the architectural governance. You will also proactively engage with business stakeholders to understand their roadmaps. From there, you'll translate them into architectural solutions, clearly articulating the business value of key design choices.

 **Additional responsibilities are:**

* Act as E2E responsible architect within your area of responsibility.
* Ensure that the IT landscape is aligned with V.A.S. target architecture and meets functional-, non-functional and security requirements
* Support and guide ongoing projects in the domain with advice and direction regarding implementation, configuration, integration, etc.
* Act as translator between business requirements/needs and the technical solution/realization.

  

The location for this position is Gothenburg - Sweden.

  

We are actively working to establish teams that harness the strengths inherent in differences. This includes variances in knowledge, experience, age, gender, nationality, and other factors. We find that balanced work teams increase group dynamics, creativity, and new approaches to solutions.

 **Curious and want to know more about the role? Get in touch:**


Stefan Hällentorp, Head of Architecture & Data. Phone: +46 739 02 10 25

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 ***Our focus*** *on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.*

 *Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join* ***Volvo Group****. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.*

 *Part of Volvo Group,* ***Volvo Autonomous Solutions*** *accelerates the development, commercialization and sales of autonomous transport solutions, focusing on defined segments for the on- and off-road space. The combination of strong tech expertise and skilled customer solutions creates innovative transport offers never seen before. We are constantly pushing our own skills and ability to drive change in a traditional industry to meet a growing customer demand. We are now looking for innovative, committed individuals to join us in our endeavor to create customer solutions that enhance safety, flexibility and productivity.*
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Frontend Developer**
Are you passionate about crafting captivating user interfaces, particularly for AI-driven applications, to elevate user experiences? We are on the lookout for a talented Frontend Developer with a flair for AI technologies, ready to dive into the realm of access solutions and leave a significant mark. If you're driven to innovate and thrive in a dynamic environment, this could be your chance to shine! Can you bring an innovative eye to ASSA ABLOY Entrance Systems Group? Join our team and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
**Location:** our office is located in Landskrona and we have a hybrid working model.  


**What you would do as our Frontend Developer**
As a Frontend Developer, you will be responsible for designing and developing interactive user interfaces for web applications primarily within the AI realm. You will translate design concepts into functional code, ensuring a seamless user experience across different devices and browsers. You would also:
* Develop and maintain frontend applications to meet business requirements and user needs.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and test user interfaces.
* Ensure the scalability, reliability, and performance of frontend systems.
* Troubleshoot and debug issues, providing timely resolution to maintain seamless user experiences.
* Providing technical support throughout the developed applications lifecycles.
* Continuously explore and implement best practices in frontend development and AI to enhance efficiency and quality.


**The skills and experience you need:**
We are looking for someone who:
* Possess 2+ years of experience in a relevant role, with demonstrated proficiency in Typescript, JavaScript, and React.
* Has an experience from working with cloud environment and infrastructure (Azure is a plus).
* Is fluent in English.
* Has previous experience with UX design is a plus.
* Has Previous experience or a high interest in generative AI and other AI-areas.
* Has Previous experience in or open to learning and exploring beyond frontend development, including backend development and cloud infrastructure tasks.


**What we offer:**
We are passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits so you can continue to develop a lifelong career with us – here's what we have to offer:
* Opportunities for learning and career development, whether it's online learning, leadership training, or improving your skills.
* A competitive salary.
* A pleasant work environment with high professional competence–informal and dynamic organization.
* Collective agreement.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait.**
We are building diverse and inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who can envision themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here no later than 15th of June, 2024.
To ensure that your personal information is secure, we do not review any applications sent via email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, please send an email to Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.
Let's together create a safer and more open world!
To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com.  


**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**  

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: DevOps Engineer - Software Configuration
description:
We are now looking for a DevOps Engineer (on behalf of our client) for a long-term on-site assignment in Lund.


The preliminary duration is 12 month, with an option to extend it to 36 month in total.  

  

**Required skills and knowledge:**  

  

* Help with maintenance and operations of deployment tools using Ansible
* Help to respond to and solve user tickets for your functional domain (the user base will mostly be technical; software developers and automation engineers)
* Maintain contact with other IT teams to maintain and operate the monitoring and alerting Infrastructure
* Develop new features as requested by developer communities
* Keep applications and services up-to-date by providing patches or upgrading according to a release Lifecyle
* Update documentation and support other team members with their backlog of tasks.

  

**Desired skills and knowledge**  

  

* Problem solving attitude
* Knowledge of container orchestration tools (e.g. Kubernetes)
* Knowledge and previous experience with git distributed version control system and have worked with either GitHub, Bitbucker, Gitlab or similar web based system
* Administration capabilities of Linux based computing systems
* Knowledge of logging infrastructure such as Prometheus or Opensearch/Elastic
* Experience with automation solution for configuration management such as Ansible, Salt, Puppet or Terraform
* Comfortable with Python, Bash and other Shell scripting.
**Soft skills:**


The candidate should have excellent oral and written communication skills, be self-motivated, take own initiatives and pay attention to details.

**Language:**

  

Good oral and written communication skills in English.

**No remote available:**


This assignment is 100% onsite and will require your physical presence in Lund.

***We offer continuously, and therefore strongly advise you to apply immediately if you find this assignment interesting and believe you are a great fit.***

title: QA Engineer
description:
Logitech is the Sweet Spot for people who want their actions to have a positive global impact while having the flexibility to do it in their own way.

**The Team and Role**  

Do you want to work in a global market but in a small and tight team? Do you want to contribute to software that will be used by millions of users? Do you want to help us shape The New Logic Of Work? If you said “Yes!”, on all three - we got the position for you!


We are looking to expand our team with a new member that is all about quality. As a QA engineer you'd be involved at the core of the multi faceted development process, to ensure the quality of the teams output.


Meetio set a new standard for meeting room management with the introduction of the Room-tablet in 2014. As a part of Logitech, we today offer industry leading software solutions for hot desking, mobile scheduling, wayfinding, and room management. Always with focus on simplicity, ease-of-use, and efficiency. We believe that the hybrid workplace (working both from home and the office) is the future. We want to be a leading player in the evolution of the workplace of the future, and we strive to build the best solutions for the people in it.


The QA Engineering role is new in the team, and you will be responsible for setting up and continuously enhance the processes and methodologies to ensure the team works in a way that is promoting great end product quality. We're looking for you who is craving a sense of ownership of the quality assurance, you who welcome the challenge instead of shying away.

 **Your Contribution**  

Be Yourself. Be Open. Stay Hungry and Humble. Collaborate. Challenge. Decide and just Do. Share our passion for Equality and the Environment. These are the behaviors and values you'll need for success at Logitech. In this role you will:

* Ensure the quality of Logitech Video Collaboration devices and systems.
* Work closely with developers to communicate defects and verify fixes throughout the software development lifecycle.
* Testing Android embedded applications and Web APIs to ensure high-quality performance and user experience.
* Develop and maintain detailed test documentation; including test cases, test scenarios, and test reports.
* Perform daily sanity tests.
* Test features/bug fixes alongside the team.
* Support the functional team with testing activities.
* Help with bug reproduction.
* Set up test environments and testing labs.
* Continuously enhance testing processes and methodologies to improve efficiency and effectiveness.

**Key Qualifications**  

For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and experiences to our team:

* 3+ years of industry experience.
* Experience with writing functional test plans.
* Experience with manual testing of embedded systems.
* Knowledge of ADB tools.
* Basic understanding of networking; IP address, MAC address, proxies, VLAN, DHCP.
* Basic understanding of network protocols and tools like HTTP/HTTPS, JSON serialization, Postman, Curl.
* Must be comfortable using Mac and Windows.

**Meriting Qualifications**

* Familiar with web security standards
* Experience with automation testing tools/frameworks, such as Selenium or Appium

  

Across Logitech we empower collaboration and foster play.  

We help teams collaborate/learn from anywhere, without compromising on productivity or continuity so it should be no surprise that most of our jobs are open to work from home from most locations. Our hybrid work model allows some employees to work remotely while others work on-premises. Within this structure, you may have teams or departments split between working remotely and working in-house.


Logitech is an amazing place to work because it is full of authentic people who are inclusive by nature as well as by design. Being a global company, we value our diversity and celebrate all our differences. Don't meet every single requirement? Not a problem. If you feel you are the right candidate for the opportunity, we strongly recommend that you apply. We want to meet you!


We offer comprehensive and competitive benefits packages and working environments that are designed to be flexible and help you to care for yourself and your loved ones, now and in the future. We believe that good health means more than getting medical care when you need it. Logitech supports a culture that encourages individuals to achieve good physical, financial, emotional, intellectual and social wellbeing so we all can create, achieve and enjoy more and support our families. We can't wait to tell you more about them being that there are too many to list here and they vary based on location.

*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.*

*If you require an accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at 510-713- 4866 for assistance.*

**LI-SN1**

title: UI Programmer
description:
Avalanche Studios is currently hiring a UI Programmer to join one of our cutting edge AAA project development teams, to help implement the User Interface. As a UI Programmer, you will work closely with your colleagues from the Design and Art teams to bring their vision for the user interface to life. And you will be tasked with maintaining consistency between UI mockups and the actual implementation in the game. On the technical side, this can mean developing new UI widgets, but also working on the C++ UI backend, developing systems and solutions to meet the UI needs of the game, hooking up data flows between the game and presentation layers, and fixing performance issues.  

Delivering a successful end-user experience does not end with you delivering a technical solution. You must be able to work with multiple systems simultaneously and parse the needs of the stakeholders on the project. And you must be able to balance the technical requirements with aesthetic ones when it comes to performance, stability, memory usage, and maintainability of our code.  

Besides the responsibilities of your project, you will also be a member of our vertically-integrated Crafts platform. This is where you can share knowledge with developers of the same Craft across our projects and align on what makes for the best user interfaces in our games.  

**Required Qualifications**  

* Experience with writing readable, robust, and performant C++
* Experience working with JavaScript code
* Experience with writing clean and maintainable Javascript and/or Typescript
* Strong communication and teamwork skills
* Fluent in spoken and written English

  

**Desired Qualifications**  

* Experience with Coherent Gameface or Prysm for developing user interfaces
* Used HTML5 for game development
* Used JavaScript frameworks like React, Vue, etc
* Shipped at least one title (PC and console platforms are preferred but others are also acceptable)
* A keen eye for detail and good user experience (UX) design
**Employee promise**  

At Avalanche Studios Group, we provide goals, instead of instructions, and the opportunity to do the best work of your career. We believe in worlds beyond limits and are committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity at our company and believe that everyone at Video game Company Group has a shared responsibility to create an open and inclusive work environment where everyone is treated equally and with respect. Being part of our world is not contingent on where you’re from, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity. **How to apply**  

We will only consider candidates who have submitted their CV in English and who can work from one of our studios in Malmö or Stockholm, a few days a week. To apply for this position, please register on our website. We review applications on a rolling basis, so apply as soon as possible. All further information is provided under non-disclosure agreement only.

title: Software Engineer for Distributed Systems
description:
**About Neo4j:**

Neo4j is the leader in Graph Database & Analytics, helping organizations uncover hidden relationships and patterns across billions of data connections deeply, easily and quickly. Customers use Neo4j to gain a deeper understanding and reveal new ways of solving their most pressing problems. Over 75% of Fortune 100 companies use Neo4j, along with a vibrant community of 250,000+ developers, data scientists, and architects across the globe.



At Neo4j, we’re proud to be building the technology that powers breakthrough solutions for our customers, helping them cure diseases, fight fraud, crush pandemics, and accomplish their most ambitious missions—even if it’s getting humans to Mars. Learn more at neo4j.com and follow us @Neo4j.

  


**Our Vision:**

At Neo4j, we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.



As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships. We created, drive and lead the graph database category, and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.



**The Role:**



We are looking for experienced backend engineers to join our team which mainly develops the distributed aspects of the Neo4j database. Building on our fast and open source native graph database, our team delivers critical enterprise features such as high availability, distributed consistency, horizontal scalability and deployment flexibility.



We’re particularly excited to hear from people who have developed and maintained non-trivial distributed systems before; who have experienced some of their pain points and design trade-offs first hand.  

  

Your contributions will be deployed in production environments around the world, vital to the varied and demanding use cases of our customers.


### **What the work is like:**


* The day-to-day work is quite wide-reaching in the database stack, from low-level (efficient IO systems where every flush and allocation counts) to high (distributed control planes where predictability and stability are vital).
* We have a development culture focused on taking the time needed to achieve quality and correctness. However, there is plenty of room for pragmatism and fast paced problem solving.
* Apart from coding features, you’ll also work with support engineers to track down tough bugs, SREs to support our database as a service offering, and with product managers and other teams to design new features.
* You’ll also spend time learning, thinking and experimenting. Specializing in topics that interest you and helping to grow yourself, the team and the product.

### **What you'll bring:**


* Ability to work independently within a flexible software development organization
* Ability to communicate about, and collaborate on, complex topics.
* Experience of distributed systems through usage, administration or development.
* Desire to learn modern and high performance Java programming (or prior knowledge).
* Desire to work as part of a geographically distributed team.

### **Nice to have:**


* Experience building stateful distributed systems (such as databases, message brokers or stream processing systems)
* Experience working with distributed orchestration systems, such as Kubernetes.
* Experience of distributed systems through usage, administration or development.
* Existing knowledge of Java programming, the Java ecosystem or JVM internals.
* Experience with working on large code bases.

**Why Join Neo4j?**

Neo4j is, without question, the most popular graph database in the world. We have customers in every industry across the globe, and our products are a proven product/market fit. Joining our team is an opportunity to shape the future of data and analytics. Below are just a few exciting facts about Neo4j.


* Neo4j is one of the fastest scaling technology companies in this industry. Well over $100M ARR and still rapidly growing.
* Raised biggest round of funding in all of database history ($325M Series F).
* Backed by world class investors like Google Ventures (GV), Neo4j has raised over $582M in funding and is currently valued at $2Bn. This puts them among the most well-funded database companies in history.
* 75% of Fortune 100 use Neo4j with more than 800 enterprise customers including Comcast, eBay, Adobe, Lyft, UBS, IBM, Volvo Cars and many more.
* Emil Eifrem (CEO) has built an amazing culture that prides itself on relationships, inclusiveness, innovation and customer success.
* Countless awards in the industry. Massive Enterprises and individual developers/ data scientists love Neo4j. Strong sense of community and ecosystem is built around the platform.
* A recent Forrester Total Economic Impact Study pegged Neo4j as delivering 417% ROI to customers.


Research shows that members of underrepresented communities are less likely to apply for jobs when they don’t meet all of the qualifications. **If this is part of the reason you hesitate to apply, we’d encourage you to reconsider and give us the opportunity to review your application.** At Neo4j, we are committed to building awareness and helping to improve these issues.



One of our central objectives is to provide an inclusive, diverse, and equitable workplace for everyone to develop their potential and have a positive, career-defining experience. We look forward to receiving your application.



**Neo4j Values:**

Neo4j is a Silicon Valley company with a Swedish soul. We foster collaboration and each of us is empowered to contribute and put our innovative stamp on projects. We hire candidates who reflect the following Neo4j core values:



(we)-[:VALUE]->(relationships)  

(we)-[:FOCUS\_ON]->(userSuccess)  

(we)-[:THRIVE\_IN]->(:Culture {type: [‘Open’, ‘Inclusive’]})  

(we)-[:ASSUME]->(:Intent {direction:’Positive’})  

(we)-[:WELCOME]->(:Discussions {nature: ‘IntellectuallyHonest’})  

(we)-[:DELIVER\_ON]->(ourCommitments)



Neo4j is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. Please read the privacy notice regarding Neo4j's recruitment process to understand how we will handle the personal data that you provide.


More information at www.neo4j.com.

title: Senior utvecklare till Stretch Amplify i Malmö
description:
Högre effekt i din utveckling med Stretch Amplify


**Ansök nu***Nu söker* ***Stretch Amplify*** *fler kollegor som vill vara med och bidra till innovativa och effektiva lösningar!*
Vill du vara med på vår fortsatta tillväxtresa? Om du motiveras av att arbeta med ny teknik i molnet, ta fram spännande lösningar och göra detta i tätt samarbete med våra kunder och kollegor så tror vi att du hade trivts hos oss!
Du kommer tillhöra ett drivet team med hög kompetens inom produkt- och mjukvaruutveckling. Hos oss är en del full stack och andra fokuserar till största del på antingen front-end eller back-end. Hos oss får du affärsutveckla våra kunder genom att ta fram nya lösningar, nya features eller stötta i frågor kring arkitektur och strategi.
Som person ser vi att du är nyfiken på både tekniken och människan. Du är en problemlösare som gillar att omvandla affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar, och ser till att dessa används. Du värdesätter samarbete då vi gärna arbetar i team. Du har arbetat mer än 6 år med mjukvaruutveckling och har mycket erfarenhet i bagaget som du gärna delar med dig av för att se hela teamet växa. Utöver rätt inställning så hoppas vi också du har...
Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande
Erfarenhet av att utveckla molnlösningar med C#/.NET
Erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt och DevOps (både verktyg och kultur)
Struktur, resultatfokus och enkel och tydlig kommunikation
**Teknik**
Vi vill gärna utforska och experimentera med nya tekniker för att möta framtidens behov med lösningar som är innovativa och framåtlutade.
Arbetsuppgifter och teknik kan variera mellan kund och projekt men för att ge några exempel på tekniker vi arbetar med; C#/.NET, Azure DevOps, Docker, Jenkins, EntityFramework, Vue.js, React, Blazor, SQL, Microservices, WEB API och mycket mer! **Du kan förvänta dig att få**
Arbeta i en mix av inhouse leveranser och externa leveranser
Möjlighet till karriärsutveckling – alltid nya projekt, team och kunder
En flexibel arbetsplats
Teamfokuserade leveranser där alla hjälps åt
Möjlighet att få påverka – design av lösningar, arkitektur och strategi
Delaktighet i att utveckla Stretch, dig själv och våra kunder
Konferenser – digitala, fysiska, interna och externa!
Nära till beslut – dina idéer är värdefulla och de vill vi satsa på!

Låter detta intressant så hittar du knappen nedan för att komma i kontakt med oss!  

  

P.S. Det finns ju massa andra förmåner och praktiskt också. Låt oss ta det när vi ses!

title: Lead Developer – Dynamics 365 Commerce & Integration
description:
### **Requirements**


* You are a talented Dynamics 365 Commerce software developer who can communicate clearly with non-technical audiences.
* While passionate about technology, you have a strong business sensibility and ability to connect well with clients.
* Analyzing, designing, developing, implementing and maintaining application code in a variety of contexts.
* Developing client premise-based and/or web-based software solutions.
* With application development, complex code development, application testing and component design.
* Ability to communicate clearly with non-technical audiences.
* While passionate about technology, you have a strong business sensibility and ability to connect well with clients.

  


**Technical Skills**


* Analyzing, designing, developing, implementing and maintaining application code in a variety of contexts.
* Developing client premise-based and/or web-based software solutions.
* With application development, complex code development, application testing and component design.
* Software design and development experience using C#, SQL Server, and be proficient in developing large scale web applications  

using a .Net framework.
* Deep knowledge in developing extensions for Point of Sale, Commerce Runtime and Hardware Station that include the creation of trigger &  

handlers.
* You likely have at least three years of relevant experience and a Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, computer engineering, management information systems or a related field.

  


**Desired Skills**


* DevOps.
* Technical architecture.
* Microsoft Dynamics 365 Commerce.
* Tech lead.
* Release management.
* CI/CD and building up pipelines.
* Development.
* Visual Studio.
* Visual Studio Code.
* Data modelling.
* Software documentation.
* Azure Devops.
* GitHub.
* XML.
* JSON.
* Power platform experience – using power platform to build adoptions/reports/apps as addons to D365 FnO.

title: DevOps engineer with a curious mind
description:
##### **Are you a DevOps engineer with a curious mind that can join us on our modernization journey? We need to strengthen the team with a DevOps engineer who knows their way around the cloud and is used to running containers with Kubernetes.**


Our current tech playground is a hybrid of a legacy monolith and newly built microservices, On-Prem data centers and Cloud services. For a while we had the ambition to go “All in” on Cloud but recently we started to explore how to establish a modern On-Prem setup for some of our solutions, while others will stay in the Cloud. In other words, to enjoy working at Prisjakt you need to master both the Cloud and have experience of On-Prem solutions.


At Prisjakt we work in a domain setup and live by agile principles. All teams work with CI/CD, meaning frequent deployments to production that the teams do themselves. As DevOps engineer we would like you to work especially close with our developers. On a daily basis the DevOps team split their time on building DevOps capabilities, maintaining/upgrading existing solutions as well as supporting our development teams with various DevOps and platform requests. You will also be part of our On Call team that practise “first aid” in case our site would have some health issues.

##### **Our wishlist (we understand that you might not tick all the boxes):**

* Cloud architecture, preferably Google
* Containers & Kubernetes
* Thorough understanding of CI/CD (Gitlab)
* Data-intensive applications (Kafka, Flink)
* Network & Databases
* Observability
* Infrastructure as code & Immutable infrastructure
* Automation - in all aspects :) (Terraform, Ansible)
* Event based architecture
* Elasticsearch experience is a plus
  

##### **Your characteristics:**

* *Drive* and *passion -* for DevOps tech and ways of working
* *Honest* - don’t be afraid to speak up - at Prisjakt we all do!
* *Patient* - neither Rome, nor our future architecture was built in a day
* *Communicative -* close collaboration with, and guidance to, our developers in DevOps matters.

*When*: We would like you to start tomorrow but we understand that you might have obligations today and those need to be handed over first.

*Where*: You will be located at our beautiful Malmö or Ängelholm studios.

*What we offer:* The very core in our employee experience is to care for our employees. With us you have flexible hours and a hybrid way of working where we meet 3 days per week in the studio. You get two paid working hours each week dedicated to working out and you’re always off on your birthday. If you’re curious to know more about life at Prisjakt, our benefits or why we exist you should definitely explore our career site. Want to meet the brilliant people and get a feel for the vibe at our studios? Make sure to follow us on Instagram @Prisjaktlife.

title: Web fullstack developer to Prisjakt
description:
**Web fullstack developer to Prisjakt**


At Prisjakt, we're on a mission to empower consumers to make better decisions. We aim for Prisjakt to be that trustworthy place where consumers can get a true and unbiased overview of the whole market: all products, all prices and all the information they need to make the right decision. To support this important mission we’re on the lookout for an senior web fullstack developer who’s eager to embark on the epic journey of building the best price and product comparison service in the universe.

**Your vibe and tribe**


As a senior web fullstack developer at Prisjakt your mission will be to craft the core of our product, making it the best possible experience for our users. And here’s the fun part: you won’t be alone on this adventure. You’ll be a part of one of our domain teams. These agile, cross-functional teams are dedicated to specific areas of Prisjakt. You will find yourself teaming up with brilliant people, like backend and frontend magicians, awesome native developers, UX designers, Architects and DevOps experts.


To thrive in this role we think you're a doer at heart, who loves to drive initiatives. And if you run into any obstacles along the way - you adapt, find a solution and keep going.

**Come experiment with us**


With a treasure trove of data and a bustling user base, we’ve got our hands full, but that’s where the fun begins! We love to experiment, try new things, and find out what sticks, whether it’s through small releases or A/B testing. With your teammates by your side, you’ll learn from what didn’t go as planned, adapt and celebrate together when you hit the sweet spot. What we’ll end up with is epic functionality that our users love!

**What you will bring:**

* Proven experience of Node.js, TypeScript and GraphQL
* Can build React components in your sleep
* No stranger to continuous releases
* An agile mindset and a big amount of curiosity and drive
* Pair programming is second nature

**We’d be oh-so happy if you know your way around:**

* ElasticSearch
* NextJS
* GCP or other cloud service hosting
* MySQL
* Microservice thinking

**What we offer**


The very core in our employee experience is to care for our employees. With us you have flexible hours and a hybrid way of working where we meet 3 days per week in the studio. You get two paid working hours each week dedicated to working out and you’re always off on your birthday. If you’re curious to know more about life at Prisjakt, our benefits or why we exist you should definitely explore our career site. Want to meet the brilliant people and get a feel for the vibe at our studios? Make sure to follow us on Instagram @Prisjaktlife.

title: Dynamics CE/Power Platform-Utvecklare
description:
**Om Dig:**


Vi söker en skicklig Dynamics CE-utvecklare som är trygg i att bygga och upprätthålla starka kundrelationer och som samtidigt vill arbeta med Dynamics 365 och Power Platform-utveckling. Du förstår värdet av att sätta dig in i kundens verksamhet och kan omsätta önskemål till tekniska lösningar för att skapa optimala affärsprocesser. Du behärskar både svenska och engelska flytande, i såväl tal som skrift.


För att ge dig bästa möjliga förutsättningar ser vi gärna att du:


* Har djup kunskap om Power Platform, främst model driven apps och Dynamics 365 CE.
* Har omfattande erfarenhet av att anpassa och optimera plattformen efter kundens behov.
* Är skicklig på att identifiera affärsbehov och översätta dessa till tekniska lösningar.

**En dag på Compagos Kontor:**


Som Dynamics CE/Power Platform-Utvecklare kommer du att arbeta i projektform från vårt kontor i centrala Malmö. Denna arbetsmodell uppskattas av både våra kollegor och kunder. Compagos kunder sträcker sig från medelstora företag till börsnoterade internationella koncerner.


Du kommer att samarbeta med kunniga och engagerade kollegor i flera olika projekt med varierande omfattning. Rollen erbjuder dig möjligheten att ta på dig olika ansvarsområden inom projekten och leverera skräddarsydda lösningar som skapar verkligt värde för våra kunder


**Hur vi ser på livet**


Compagos kompetens är både bred och djup och det är till stor del vår främsta styrka. Vårt självförtroende är stort och bygger på den samlade erfarenheten och enorma kunskapsbanken som våra medarbetare har.


För oss är trygghet en grundläggande värdegrund. Det handlar om att skapa en balanserad tillvaro för dig, som sträcker sig bortom en stabil månadslön. På Compago värdesätter vi gemenskap, mångfald och öppenhet. Här, utöver det professionella, finns även stort utrymme för skratt och en och annan ordvits för att krydda till tillvaron.


**Ansökan och frågor**


Har du frågor eller funderingar får du gärna höra av dig till Hanna Levin på rekrytering@compago.se. Enligt GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via mejl utan de sker enbart via den här annonsen. Du kan läsa mer om vår integritetspolicy här

title: Verksamhetsutvecklare inköp
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
--------------------


Hela Öland attraherar varje år fler och fler människor. Unika miljöer, hög livskvalitet och närheten till både stad och hav gör Öland till en attraktiv plats att besöka och leva på. Södra Öland i sin tur präglas även av stark framåtanda, engagemang och vårt fantastiska Världsarv.
  

  

Mörbylånga kommun ligger på den södra delen av Öland och består av ca 1200 engagerade och kompetenta medarbetare som drivs av att göra skillnad i vårt samhälle. Nu söker vi fler medarbetare som vill bidra till att Öland fortsätter vara en fantastisk plats att bo, arbeta och besöka.  

  



**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------


Vill du bidra till att skattepengarna används på ett effektivt sätt? I rollen som verksamhetsutvecklare inom inköp har du ett funktionsansvar och administrerar och utvecklar processer och rutiner inom inköpsområdet. Tjänsten innehåller varierande arbetsuppgifter för att utveckla kommunens inköpsarbete.
  

  

För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Mörbylånga kommun behöver du vara nyfiken, kreativ och ha förmåga att ta initiativ. Du hittar vårt personalpolitiska program här: https://www.morbylanga.se/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/personalpolitiskt-program-4.pdf
  

  

En stor del av tjänsten innefattar kontakter med kommunens verksamheter och leverantörer där du samverkar och utvecklar kommunens inköpsprocess. Du är behjälplig med stöd till verksamheterna när de ska göra inköp vilket kan göras genom e-handel, direktupphandling eller enligt gällande avtal. Du hanterar våra kataloger med produkter och stödjer inköparna att hitta rätt produkter i vår beställningsportal. Du är också behjälplig mot leverantörerna och stödjer och administrerar deras kataloger.
  

  

I rollen ingår att administrera kommunens avtalskatalog samt stödja verksamheten i sitt arbete med att följa upp avtal. Du utvecklar rutiner och annat stödmaterial och kommunicerar detta såväl internt som externt. Du kan också stödja verksamheterna vid direktupphandlingar och avtalsfrågor. Du ingår i ett team som arbetar med inköp och upphandling både operativt och strategiskt utifrån kommunens mål. Närmaste chef är ekonomichefen och tjänsten är placerad på ekonomienheten.


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Vi söker dig med gymnasieekonomexamen eller yrkesutbildning inom ekonomi, inköp, upphandling eller juridik. Du får gärna ha praktisk erfarenhet av inköp eller upphandling och har du dessutom någon form av IT-utbildning eller erfarenhet av systemförvaltning är det en bonus. Viktigast är dock att du är intresserad av system och IT i allmänhet och är en god administratör. Det är meriterande om du har arbetat i offentlig verksamhet och/eller i en politiskt styrd organisation tidigare.
  

  

Som person är du lyhörd, flexibel, noggrann och ansvarstagande. Du gillar ordning och reda och att skaffa dig koll på läget. För att trivas hos oss behöver du både kunna driva din egen utveckling och självständigt söka kunskap och samtidigt kunna ta hjälp av teamet. Du trivs med att bidra till utveckling genom att nyfiket tycka och tänka till kring processer och rutiner.
  

  

Du är strukturerad, kan tänka strategiskt och har förmågan att se verksamheten i ett helhetsperspektiv och kan koppla ihop helhet och delar, framtid och nutid. Som verksamhetsutvecklare är det också viktigt att du är utåtriktad, kreativ och nyfiken och kan tillföra energi i arbetet samt skapa delaktighet och samsyn kring kommunens inköp. Och eftersom service och användarstöd är viktiga för oss drivs du av en vilja att se möjligheter till förbättring både för verksamheterna, för dig själv och för medborgarna. För att kunna ta dig runt i kommunen behöver du ha körkort. Stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet.


**Anställningens omfattning**
-----------------------------


Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning

  

Omfattning: Heltid

  

Tillträde: Augusti 2024


Referensnummer: C195423


Ansök här


**Ersättning**
--------------


Löneform: Månadslön

  

**Övrigt**
----------


Mörbylånga kommun eftersträvar en jämnare könsfördelning i våra personalgrupper. Detta är en del av kommunens övergripande jämställdhetsarbete och som vi tar hänsyn till vid rekryteringsförfarandet.
  

  

För att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsprocessen i Mörbylånga kommun samt möjliggöra god kommunikation med våra sökande ber vi dig skicka in din ansökan digitalt. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post eller pappersformat.
  

  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
  

  

Inför rekryteringsarbetet har Mörbylånga kommun tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanbeder oss därför bestämt kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.

title: Förskollärare med SKUA-uppdrag
description:
Allas lika värde i en lustfylld lärande miljö -Vision för förskolorna i Nässjö Kommun  

  

  

  

Är du en skicklig förskollärare som vill vara med och driva förskolans Språk- och kunskapsutvecklande arbete på kommunövergripande nivå? Som förskollärare med SKUA- uppdrag kombinerar du arbete i barngrupp med strategiskt utvecklingsarbete tillsammans med två ytterligare SKUOR. Uppdraget som skua-utvecklare inom förskolan innebär att arbeta strategiskt och forskningsbaserat med att utveckla det språk- och kunskapsutvecklande arbetet i hela kommunen. Vi söker dig som är målmedveten och vill göra skillnad på riktig. I rollen kommer du vara en viktig del av det språk- och kunskapsutvecklande arbetet i Nässjö kommuns förskolor. Du är med och leder det kollegiala lärandet kommunövergripande och verkar för att undervisningen utformas för att stödja barns språk och kunskapsutveckling med utgångspunkt i läroplansuppdraget. Med utgångspunkt i Skolverkets riktade insatser har all utbildningsverksamhet i Nässjö kommun arbetat med att utveckla det språk- och kunskapsutvecklande förhållningssättet sedan 2021. Kom och var en del av vår fortsatta satsning!
  

  

80% av din tjänst arbetar du som förskollärare på Nässjös nyaste förskola. Annefors förskola är belägen i Nässjö centralort och hit åker du smidigt med både buss och tåg. Alla medarbetare har genomfört en utbildning i Språk och kunskapsutvecklande arbetssätt, vilket är det gemensamma utvecklingsområdet. Förskolan har nya, moderna och ändamålsenliga lokaler med en ateljé i mitten. Här finns stora möjligheter att utveckla en undervisning för alla barn. Till förskolan finns en stor utomhusmiljö och utomhuspedagogik är det som står på tur att utvecklas.
  

  

I Nässjö kommun arbetar ett stort antal engagerade medarbetare som året runt utför ett av de viktigaste yrkena vi har. Vi tror på, delaktighet bland medarbetare och tillsammans har vi tagit fram både en vision och en verksamhetsidé. Dessutom gillar vi korta beslutsvägar där alla kan göra sin röst hörd och dessutom vara med och påverka. Vår kultur präglas av en attityd där ingenting är omöjligt. Vi levererar resultat och lär av varandra. Förskolorna i Nässjö har förutom förskollärare, barnskötare, en rektor, en utvecklingsledare, förskollärare med utvidgat utvecklingsuppdrag samt en hög andel specialpedagoger sett till antal förskolor, så här finns det fokus på förskolan och möjlighet att utvecklas. Och nu letar vi efter dig!
  

  

Alla förskolor i kommunen har fem kompetensutvecklingsdagar per år. För tillsvidareanställd personal har vi fria arbetskläder för utomhusbruk och ett eget digitalt verktyg.
  

Vi erbjuder alla nyutexaminerade förskollärare en mentor samt en i övrigt utvecklad introduktion i arbetet. Allt för att du ska känna dig så förberedd som möjligt. Här kommer du dessutom att tillhöra en verksamhet där du får möjlighet att prova dina idéer. Sånt gillar vi!  

  



För mer information: https://nassjo.se/


**Arbetsuppgifter:**

Uppdraget innebär arbete i barngrupp cirka 80%. Resterande 20 % har du ditt fokus på ett strategiskt och kommunövergripande utvecklingsarbete med förskolans språk och kunskapsutvecklande arbetssätt. I din roll som Skua- utvecklare planerar och organiserar du för kollegialt lärande på de förskolor du tilldelas ansvar för och även gemensamma forum för förskolans alla lärledare. Tillsammans med övriga Skuor ansvarar du för att planera, genomföra nätverk och kompetenshöjande insatser samt följa upp utvecklingen av förskolans språk- och kunskapsutvecklande arbetssätt.
  

  

Du planerar, genomför, följer upp och utvecklar utbildningen utomhus mot förskolans mål tillsammans med barnen och dina kollegor, alltid med barnets bästa i fokus. Här är utveckling centralt och för oss är det lika viktigt att du upplever en personlig utveckling och att utbildningen utvecklas. Du bidrar genom att vara professionell, medveten och en reflekterande pedagog. För att tjänsten ska gälla tillsvidare krävs att du har förskollärarlegitimation.  

  



**Kvalifikationer:**

För att vara aktuell för jobbet ska du ha förskollärarlegitimation och arbetat i förskolan under några år. Vi ser gärna att har du utbildning inom språk- och kunskapsutvecklande arbete. Särskilt meriterande är erfarenhet av att leda utvecklingsarbete och kollegialt lärande. Stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet.
  

  

Som person är du nyfiken och du vågar och vill förändra det som behöver förändras. Du behöver ha god kommunikativ förmåga och personlig mognad är en förutsättning för att du ska vara trygg i din yrkesroll. Du har ett öppet, positivt nyfiket förhållningssätt som skapar goda relationer till barnen, vårdnadshavare och kollegor. Du är väl förtrogen med förskolans styrdokument.  

  

  

  

  

  

  

**Övrigt:**


För att få effektiv, snabb och säker hantering av din ansökan ber vi dig skicka din ansökan via vårt rekryteringsverktyg. Ansök direkt via länken i annonsen.
  

  

Om du har skyddad identitet och vill söka den annonserade tjänsten kan du kontakta ansvarig person för rekryteringen. Kontaktuppgifter framgår i annonsen.
  

  

Inför rekryteringsarbetet har Nässjö kommun tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför bestämt kontakt med mediasäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.


**Anställningsform:**

Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning  

Omfattning: Heltid  

Löneform: Månadslön.
  

Varaktighet: Tillsvidare  

Arbetstid: Dagtid.
  

Tillträde: Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.  

Antal platser: 2

  

**Ansökan:**

Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-06-13

title: Systemkunnig affärsutvecklare och säljansvarig
description:
**LearningWell utvecklar avancerade systemlösningar – skräddarsydda efter kundens verksamhet och behov. Det har varit en framgångsfaktor i över 20 år och har lett till långvariga kundrelationer i en rad spännande branscher, nationellt och internationellt. Vi har kontinuerligt även attraherat duktiga utvecklare. Nu är nästa steg att öka affären för att på så sätt kunna fortsätta vår expansion.**


Till vårt kontor i Nyköping söker vi därför en tekniskt bevandrad medarbetare med dokumenterad förmåga att skapa kvalificerade affärer för skräddarsydda systemlösningar. Du är ödmjuk, nyfiken och ditt största driv är att få se en lyckad lösning/tjänst hos kund. Under din karriär har du haft roller såsom systemutvecklare, kravledare, arkitekt eller produktägare, och har sadlat om till affärer och sälj med fokus på relationsbaserad försäljning

### **Om rollen som affärsutvecklare och säljansvarig**


Vi har en tradition av att kombinera teamuppdrag hos kund eller på distans med leveranser av åtagandeprojekt i form av skräddarsydda system. Samtliga leveranser och åtaganden bygger på långsiktiga relationer med en hög grad av tillit. Nyligen har vi till detta tillfogat en SaaS tjänst med stor potential, som är baserad på en tidigare systemleverans. Parallellt pågår andra spännande utvecklingsprojekt som vi tror kan intressera marknaden.

**Vem vi söker?**  

*Du som har:*  

* Erfarenhet av IT-branschen, minst 10 år eller motsvarande.
* Jobbat med kvalificerade affärer med skräddarsydda systemlösningar.
* Dokumenterad historia i att skapa affärer.
* Ett stort kontaktnät, gott rykte och som är orädd i att ta kontakt med människor.
* Naturlig förmåga att följa upp och bibehålla kundkontakter.
* En övergripande förståelse om nya tekniker och kontinuerligt tar till dig ny kunskap.
* Drivande och ansvarstagande egenskaper.

Du är självklart nyfiken på teknik, och vill arbeta med relationsbaserad försäljning och produktförsäljning. Hos oss kommer du att vara en lagspelare i en platt snabbfotad och prestigelös organisation. Vi tror även att du ser dig mer som rådgivare än försäljare.

### **Om LearningWell AB**


LearningWell AB består av två dotterbolag. LearningWell East i Nyköping och LearningWell South West med kontor i Mariestad. Här arbetar ett 50-tal utvecklare, ingenjörer och projektledare med bred kompetens inom informationsteknik, automation, digitalisering och systemintegration. Bland våra kunder finns allt från myndigheter och försvarsmakter, till process- och tillverkningsindustri, energibolag och rena tjänsteföretag.  

Värdeorden *nyfiket, ärligt, personligt* står för bolagens gemensamma grund och förhållningssätt. Vi tror starkt på en organisation som är platt och som ger medarbetarna stort inflytande över verksamheten och utvecklingen. Vi tror även på en organisation som ”lever” sin kultur – en kultur som är varm, välkomnande men med tydliga krav och återkoppling – ger arbetsglädje.  

Vårt syfte är att *Odla glädje genom att hjälpa våra kunder och varandra till helt fantastiska projekt och resultat*.


**Hos oss får du:**  

Månadslön och vinstdelning  

Maxbelopp friskvårdsbidrag  

Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring  

Flexibla arbetstider  

Värdestyrt ledarskap  

Agil företagskultur  

Roliga aktiviteter både utanför och under arbetstid  

Skidresa till alperna

### **Låter det intressant?**


Tveka i så fall inte att höra av dig till Peter Karlsson, vd på LearningWell i Nyköping, så tar vi det där ifrån.  

peter.karlsson@learningwell.se  

Telefon: 070-6312870

**Vi hörs!**

title: Partner Manager to IAR in Uppsala
company: アイエーアール・システムズ株式会社
description:
Do you have several years of experience in business development? Are you passionate about technology and relationships? Are you a strategic and analytical person who drives your work forward with clarity? IAR is seeking a Partner Manager who wants to develop with the team and contribute with previous experience and knowledge.



IAR is a world-leading provider of software and services for embedded systems development, with proprietary software solutions for security and assured quality. We are growing and need to strengthen the team with a Partner Manager. You will belong to the Product Management Team and Report to the Director of Product Management, but this role will interact with all functions in the company.



The Partner Manager´s primary goal is to actively structure, prioritize, develop, and manage relationships with strategic business partners to meet company goals and identify and leverage business and eco system growth opportunities through collaborative and mutually beneficial connections.

  



Role overview and goals


* Form a deep understanding of our ecosystem and identify the characteristics of a good business partner
* Develop a scalable model for formalizing partnerships, build and manage segmented partner programs with various objectives
* Manage and build on existing partner relationships
* Identify and develop relationships with new partners (based on business opportunity or corporate strategy requirements)
* Collaborate with sales, product, marketing, and engineering teams to develop partnership strategies and optimize business results from partner relationships
* Work with Product Management to explore possible integrations into our technology platform
* Work with partners and marketing to optimize joint marketing strategies to develop business through the ecosystem
* Take ownership of partnership reporting and performance to be able to evaluate results
* Promote IAR as a strategic business and technology partner

  



Qualifications


* 5 + years of business development experience, with a demonstrable ability to drive revenue and show results, or a proven track record of building successful partnership programs
* Partner and industry insights. Understanding of the embedded industry, business drivers, cloud platforms and emerging cloud trends for software development and deployment, and their impact on customer opportunities.
* Understanding of relevant technical concepts and ability to communicate with technical stakeholders
* Strongly capable of effectively communicating value propositions to all stakeholders
* Proven record of achieving targets and driving revenue in a high-growth, rapidly evolving organization
* You have experience working in an international environment and are fluent in spoken and written English. Swedish is a merit.


You are a strategic and analytical thinker who understands technology and business strategy and can excel at relationship-building and inspiring internal and external stakeholders. Furthermore, you are passionate about technology and relationships and willing to travel.

  



What we offer you  

We offer you an exciting opportunity as Partner Manager in a global tech company operating in multiple territories. In this role you are given the opportunity for hybrid work.

  



Application  

In this recruitment process, IAR is supported by Jurek Recruitment & Consulting. Interviews will be carried out as applications are received, so please apply as soon as possible via www.jurek.se. Please note that we do not accept applications by mail. For any questions, please get in touch with recruitment consultant Emelie Prokop at emelie.prokop@jurek.se

  



About IAR  

IAR Systems, founded in 1983 in Uppsala, Sweden, is the world´s leading provider of software and services for developing embedded systems and a part of the globally known Swedish engineering heritage. This engineering process has given the world Systema Naturae by Carl von Linné, the Centigrade scale by Anders Celsius, and Volvo by Assar Gabrielsson and Gustaf Larsson. IAR is part of the Swedish engineering history of inventors and engineers who have made the world better and pushed humanity toward progress through technological innovations and solutions.



Engineering is in our name and DNA and at the core of everything we do. However, we are not just about technology. Our core lies in the curiosity, courage, and passion that drive all of us at IAR. Together, we aim to reach new heights by enabling our embedded engineers everywhere to build a brighter, better world.



At IAR, we are engaged in a continuous engineering journey, providing the technology for engineers to be innovative, productive, and efficient. After 40 years in business, our home and heart are still in Uppsala, where we started, but we now serve and support our customers globally from 13 offices in almost every time zone and continent. Together, we strive to deliver a secure and intelligent embedded development experience.  

IAR provides world leading software and services that accelerate developer productivity in embedded development and embedded security, enabling companies worldwide to create and secure the products of today and the innovations of tomorrow.

  



Område: Uppsala (hybrid)



Anställning: Tillsvidare



Omfattning: Heltid
company_addresses: 東京都千代田区神田須田町１－２１－５

title: Utvecklare inom inbyggda system
description:
**Vem är du?**  

Vi söker en erfaren mjukvaruutvecklare som gillar embedded, C och C++. Du som går igång på möjligheten att fortsätta utvecklas och prova något nytt trots att du redan har minst 5 års erfarenhet.
Våra kunder är allt från de stora bolagen inom fordon, försvar, gruvindustri och läkemedel, till de lite mindre som kanske inte har någon egen utvecklingsavdelning. Det ger en bredd av utmaningar och även variation i form av programspråk och utvecklingsmiljö.
Vi vill att du som person är nyfiken, gillar teknik och har en önskan att skapa den bästa lösningen för våra kunder. Du tar ansvar för ditt arbete och det är ett stort plus om du precis som vi gillar att ha roligt på jobbet!**Vad gör vi?**  

Under de senaste åren har vi hunnit utveckla styrsystem åt stora tillverkande företag, skapat bildanalysverktyg för PC med egna smarta algoritmer samt visualiserat produkter i multi user VR. Vi avbildar ytor i 3D med egenutvecklad kamerateknik, vi har byggt prototyper för autonoma fordon och implementerat mjukvara för att hantera omvärldens ökade krav på cybersäkerhet.
Flera av våra partners är lite mindre företag där vi fungerar som deras externa FoU-avdelning och där vi arbetar tillsammans för att se vad vi kan åstadkomma med elektronik och digitalisering. Till de stora företagen erbjuder vi allt oftare specialistkunskap på distans från våra kontor i form av satellitverksamhet, där vi kan erbjuda kompetens som är svår för dem att hitta lokalt.
Oavsett vilken kund vi arbetar tillsammans med, eller storlek på projekt, är målsättningen att alltid erbjuda våra medarbetare en chans att ta nästa steg i sin utveckling.
**Hur vi rullar?**
På Knightec får du en arbetsplats med personer som bryr sig. Din vilja, intressen och ambitioner leder vägen, vi förser dig med verktygen och förutsättningarna för att lyckas. Vår miljö präglas av tillit, transparens och samarbete. När du tycker något är lätt finns alltid någon som behöver stöttning av dig och när du tycker något är svårt finns alltid hjälp att få. Det viktiga är att du inte ger upp då vi tror att tillfredställelsen i att lösa en svår uppgift är mycket mer givande än att lösa något vi redan kan.
Knightec har 11 kontor i Sverige. Just denna tjänst gäller för placering i Umeå. Vi erbjuder fräscha, centralt placerade lokaler och jobbar aktivt för en levande och starkt kontorsgemenskap. För att i underlätta vardagen för individen så är arbete på distans delar av veckan också vanligt förekommande. Vi tror på värdet i att ta en kaffe tillsammans och snickesnacka runt tekniska problem eller fritidsintressen på plats på vårt kontor. Om du också gillar att cykla MTB med oss, att baka tyska kringlor eller något annat som du gillar, så kommer det här bli väldigt bra.

title: Senior Frontend Developer within Savings Offering \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant development teams are focused on future- proofing SEB’s digital architecture and customer offering because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you? **What you will be doing:**
You will be a part of the exiting journey to explore, design and develop the future of the Savings platform.  

The team is responsible for developing and maintaining savings functionality in our digital channels which includes the Internet Bank, mobile apps and an internal system for advisors. Our main priority now is to develop new functionality for the mobile apps and to modernize our Internet Bank. You will be a part of an agile team with motivated and creative colleagues that work in close collaboration with our product owners, business specialists and other teams within Technology
### **Our technical stack consists of:**

* Angular
* React
* JavaScript/TypeScript
* HTML/CSS
* GitHub
* Azure DevOps
* .NET Core
* C#
* OpenShift

### **To succeed in the role, you should have:**

* Worked as a frontend developer using modern JavaScript frameworks for several years
* Worked closely with backend developers and testers to integrate micro frontends with backend APIs
* A passion for development and continuous learning of new technologies, platforms, and tools
* A proactive mind set and a strong sense of ownership and responsibility
* Lead the development of modern frontend architecture using reusable components
* Experience in agile methodologies, mentoring junior developers and sharing your knowledge
* A strong understanding of current web design principles and best practices
* A bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent

### **It is meritable if you have:**

* Experience in development of micro service APIs using .NET
* Knowledge of web accessibility guidelines and tools
* Experience in DevSecOps practices
* Experience in frontend architecture
* Experience in cloud platforms
* An interest in the financial market

### **What we offer:**

* Innovative company in the forefront of technology
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Attractive compensation and benefits
* Work-life balance
* Friendly and welcoming cultur

**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-06-23. If you have questions about the position, please contact Lena Fureman, Team Manager, at lena.fureman@seb.se.
**Learn more about working at SEB** www.sebgroup.com/career
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Cloud Network specialist with a passion for scripting \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
Are you passionate about Cloud technology and making a difference? Join our digital transformation!  

At SEB we are embarking on an exciting tech transformation journey and are seeking a talented, motivated and security aware Developer to join our Network Team. If you have a passion for infrastructure development & maintenance, and the desire to work on cutting-edge technology solutions in a dynamic environment on Cloud platforms, on-premises and hybrid environments, we want to hear from you. **About the role:**
As a Cloud engineer in the Network team, you will play a crucial role in contributing to, optimizing and managing our enterprise security layers for applications at SEB. You will work alongside a team of skilled professionals to ensure seamless development, management, troubleshooting, and integration. Your technical expertise and problem-solving skills will be essential in maintaining the security, stability and performance of our systems.
### **Key responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with a team of 20 to maintain and develop SEB's Global Network including work with Control Mechanisms for security, stability, scalability and, automations
* Balance the needs of our existing environment with our transition to the Cloud
* Provide Infrastructure as Code possibilities for SEB’s application teams
* Continuously identify opportunities for innovation
* Troubleshoot issues and develop effective solutions
* Continuously strive for process improvements, standardization, and automation for speed and precision

### **To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**

* A habit to ideate, prototype and verify several solutions to determine a great solution
* Security awareness
* Experience with Infrastructure and Cloud technologies
* Proficiency in Python, Checkpoint firewalls, Cisco routing/switching, Terraform, Ansible,
* Experience and/or familiarity in networking concept and technologies within GCP, AWS and Azure and Multi Cloud Connectivity design and operations
* IaC skills
* Familiarity with DevOps practices
* Troubleshooting and problem-solving experience
* Communication skills in Swedish and English

### **What we offer:**

* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Exciting cloud transformation journey
* Collaborative and dynamic work environment
* Opportunities for professional growth and development
* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* Hybrid workplace

**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.  

If you are a highly motivated team player with a strong background in Cloud development, security layers, troubleshooting and a desire to contribute to our cloud transformation journey, we encourage you to apply.  

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 16th of June 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Elinor Franzén, Talent Acquisition Partner, at elinor.franzen@seb.se.  

Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
